Documentation.Description: This is a generic timeout error
Documentation.Message: An operation timed out
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: BMC code had a generic internal failure
Documentation.Message: An application had an internal failure
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: BMC code was given an invalid argument
Documentation.Message: Code was given an invalid argument
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: An operation failed due to insufficient permission
Documentation.Message: An operation failed due to unsufficient permission
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: An operation failed because it isn't allowed
Documentation.Message: An operation failed because it isn't allowed
Notes: The journal should contain more information

Documentation.Description: The server's CA certificate has not been provided
Documentation.Message: The server's CA certificate has not been provided

Documentation.Description: Sensor device read failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when reading a sensor device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Device read failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when reading a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Device write failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when writing to a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH

Documentation.Description: Device write failure
Documentation.Message: There was a failure when writing to a hardware device
Notes: The severity is set by the creator.
The action flags are set automatically by the code.
Callouts added based on CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH

Documentation.Description: The BMC sent the host a malformed PEL
Documentation.Message: The BMC sent the host a malformed PEL
Notes: The host firmware rejected that PEL.

6.Description: The PLID of the invalid PEL

7.Description: The corresponding OpenBMC event log ID

8.Description: The size of the invalid PEL

Documentation.Description: The host sent the BMC an invalid PEL
Documentation.Message: The host sent the BMC an invalid PEL

Documentation.Description: An error for testing
Documentation.Message: This is a test error

Documentation.Description: This entry is used when no other matching entry is found
Documentation.Message: Unknown (Original event not in message registry)
Notes: This is used when the actual error name isn't found in
the registry.  The original error name will be stored
in the UserData section that contains the AdditionalData
properties using the key ERROR_NAME.
This error may contain callouts if the creator passed
them in.
The severity is set by the creator.
If this error is seen, then a code change needs to be
made to add the missing error entry to this registry.

Documentation.Description: Failure occured during boot process
Documentation.Message: Failure occured during boot process
Notes: Debug traces will be captured in AdditionalData section

Documentation.Description: Status shows TI special attention active
Documentation.Message: TI special attention detected
Notes: This entry is for any TI special attention event
reported by the attention handler component

Documentation.Description: The attention handler encountered an error
Documentation.Message: Attention handler error %1
Notes: Attention handler will provide error code

Documentation.Description: Status shows SBE vital attention active
Documentation.Message: SBE vital attention detected
Notes: This entry is for any SBE vital attention event
reported by the attention handler component

6.Description: [0:15] chip model, [16:23] reserved, [24:31] chip EC level

7.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] unused, [24:31] signature attn type

8.Description: [0:15] signature ID, [16:23] signature instance, [24:31] signature bit position

Documentation.Description: A system checkstop attention has occurred
Documentation.Message: hw-diags signature: %1 %2 %3

6.Description: [0:15] chip model, [16:23] reserved, [24:31] chip EC level

7.Description: [0:15] chip position, [16:23] unused, [24:31] signature attn type

8.Description: [0:15] signature ID, [16:23] signature instance, [24:31] signature bit position

Documentation.Description: A hardware attention requiring service has occurred
Documentation.Message: hw-diags signature: %1 %2 %3

Documentation.Description: Power Supply input power fault
Documentation.Message: A power supply has indicated an input or under voltage condition.
Notes: Check the power supply cabling and/or input power
source. The PWRSPLY procedure is used rather than
calling out a location code, as typically these faults
are related to the supplied power, the cable, or the
cable connectors. If the input fault resolves down to an
issue with the power supply itself, the power supply
indicating this input fault should be called out. Add the
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH to the additional data, and set the
CALLOUT_PRIORITY to something other than high.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply power fault
Documentation.Message: The power supply detected a fault condition, see AdditionalData for further details.
Notes: The power supply reporting the fault should be called
out using the CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH keyword. Include
specific fault, STATUS_* details, and code level in the
AdditionalData section.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply non-power fault
Documentation.Message: A communication failure occurred talking to the power supply
Notes: Communication problems with the power supply could be
the power supply, or any hardware between it and the
BMC. Reporting the error should be passing in a call
out using CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH.

Documentation.Description: Power Supply is missing
Documentation.Message: A power supply that should be present is missing
Notes: The CalloutList should use the PWRSPLY symbolic FRU
with the trusted location code property.  The
location code in this callout is obtained from
the passed in CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH value.

Documentation.Description: A power off was issued because a power fault was detected
Documentation.Message: A power off was issued because a power fault was detected

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a PGOOD fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a PGOOD fault

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a voltage fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a voltage fault

Documentation.Description: A write verification error occurred on a device
Documentation.Message: A write verification error occurred on a device
Notes: This error occurs when a device register is written,
read back, and the two values do not match.  This is
also called a read-back error.  The device should be
identified using the CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH or
CALLOUT_IIC_BUS/CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR keywords in the
AdditionalData property of the event log.  This will
cause the device and the hardware in the communication
path to be called out.

Documentation.Description: A regulators configuration file error occurred
Documentation.Message: A regulators configuration file error occurred
Notes: The regulators configuration file could not be found,
could not be read, or had invalid contents.

Documentation.Description: The power sequencer chip detected a fault
Documentation.Message: The power sequencer chip detected a fault

Documentation.Description: System power failed to turn on
Documentation.Message: System power failed to turn on

Documentation.Description: An internal firmware error occurred
Documentation.Message: An internal firmware error occurred
Notes: The error details must be provided in the AdditionalData
property of the event log.

Documentation.Description: An I2C error occurred communicating with a device
Documentation.Message: An I2C error occurred communicating with a device
Notes: The device should be identified using the
CALLOUT_DEVICE_PATH or CALLOUT_IIC_BUS/CALLOUT_IIC_ADDR
keywords in the AdditionalData property of the event
log.  This will cause the device and the hardware in the
communication path to be called out.

Documentation.Description: A PMBus error occurred on a device
Documentation.Message: A PMBus error occurred on a device
Notes: This error occurs when the I2C communication was
successful, but the PMBus value read is invalid or
unsupported.  CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH should be specified
in the AdditionalData property of the event log so that
the device is called out but not the communication path.

Documentation.Description: A firmware inter-process communication (D-Bus) error occurred
Documentation.Message: A firmware inter-process communication (D-Bus) error occurred

Documentation.Description: Fan rotor fault
Documentation.Message: Fan rotor fault
Notes: This error occurs when a fan rotor has been faulted for a
certain amount of time.  The callout is the fan which is
passed in with CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH.  The severity is
passed in during creation and will be either informational
or unrecoverable.  The action flags use the defaults and
vary based on the severity.

Documentation.Description: A fan is missing
Documentation.Message: A fan is missing
Notes: This error occurs when a fan has been missing for a
certain amount of time.  The first callout is the
symbolic FRU AIR_MOVR that has the trusted fan location
code, which it gets using the passed in
CALLOUT_INVENTORY_PATH.  The second callout is the FRU
where the controller is.

Documentation.Description: A path access error ocurred
Documentation.Message: An EEPROM path access error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when parser is unable to access
EEPROM path. Errno and device path are captured as
additional data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid VPD data.
Documentation.Message: A VPD data exception occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when VPD data is found to be
invalid. This can be when VPD file is missing out
mandatory records.Inventory path is captured in
additional data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid VPD ecc data.
Documentation.Message: A VPD ecc exception occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when VPD ecc check fails for the FRU.
Inventory path for the failed FRU is captured in additonal
data.

Documentation.Description: Invalid Json
Documentation.Message: A Json failure occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when parser fails to access
Json file or there is any issue with Json data.
Failed Json path and cause of failure is captured
in additional data.

Documentation.Description: System VPD restore failed
Documentation.Message: A system VPD restoration error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when restoring of system VPD fails.
The FRU path and reason for failure is captured in
additional data.

Documentation.Description: Dbus exception
Documentation.Message: A Dbus internal error occurred.
Notes: This error occurs when Dbus operation fails.
Exceptions details are captured in additonal
data.
